availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Mariah E. Goodloe Barret. Later married to Margaretta Mason Brown Barret. Father of Henry O. Barret, Mary Barret, John Barrett, William Barret, and Lizzie Barret. Graduated Centre College. Practiced in partnership with James Speed.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, stamped p. 120. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, 8th Ward, p. 86. “William F. Barret Dead,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), September 29, 1882, p. 8.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910). Microfilm rolls #994027-994058. Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky.
